alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 7:20PM EDT until March 24 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms were developing and increasing in areal coverage and intensity across Ashe, Alleghany, and Watauga Counties in northwest North Carolina. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, especially in low-lying, poor drainage, and normally flood prone areas. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Alleghany NC, Ashe and Watauga. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM EDT, Showers and thunderstorms were increasing in areal coverage and intensity from near Beech Mountain and Boone northeast toward Jefferson and Sparta. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Brush Creek, Brushy Fork, Elk Creek, Grassy Creek, Darnell Creek, Crab Fork, George Gap Branch, Dutch Creek, Dog Creek, Call Creek, Cove Creek, Craborchard Creek, Beech Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boone... Sparta... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Blowing Rock... Lansing... Glendale Springs... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
